resource.name: Community 2005-2017 Greenhouse Gas Emissions
resource.description: This dataset includes the community greenhouse gas emissions data for Evanston as a community in detail. The municipal emissions inventory is included but only as lump sums and individual emission source data for the municipal inventory is not yet available. The City anticipates released a separate municipal inventory in June, 2019. Details on emissions inventory methodology and Evanston's Climate Action and Resilience Plan (CARP) can be found at www.cityofevanston.org/climate

resource.name: Food Establishment Businesses
resource.description:
Contains all business that have had food inspections during the current or previous year. 

This data set contains the Last Inspected date. If this date for the Business is newer than the most recent Inspection date in the Food Establishment Inspections data set, then the Business has a perfect score of 100.

Food Establishment Inspection data is contained in three data sets:

Food Establishment Businesses
Food Establishment Inspections
Food Establishment Violations


Data set relationships

Business: one to many -> Inspections (key: License Number)
Inspections: one to many -> Violations (key: License Number, Inspection Date)

resource.description: Complete data for the 2019 and 2020 Adopted Budget, and 2021 Projected Budget.
columns_description: Assigned number corresponding to department name.
Assigned number corresponding to business unit name.
A specific expense or revenue line by kind of spending. These are used across funds and departments.
The City's budget is organized into funds. A fund is a separate accounting entity with a self-balancing set of accounts. The 2020 Proposed Budget includes 38 funds.
Assigned number corresponding to fund name.
Type of budget account - salaries and benefits, services and supplies, etc.
Divisions or smaller operating units within a department.
The City's major operating units. Most departments have operations in multiple funds.
